newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends steady as C Bank buys dlrs.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends steady as C Bank buys dlrs.

text.p: The Philippine peso closed unchanged at 26.374 to the dollar despite a moderate inflow of foreign exchange into domestic short-term investment securities, traders said.
The Central Bank had to buy dollars at 26.374 to curb the peso appreciation, one trader said.
"We saw some fresh dollar inflows into money market instruments which offer relatively higher interest rates. But the Central Bank was there to keep the peso from rising too fast," he said.
The Central Bank kept its benchmark overnight rate at 15 percent, prompting money market traders to anticipate further rises in domestic interest rates.
A total of $239.30 million changed hands with rates wedged between 26.375 and 26.374. Value-today trades were done at 26.368 and 26.369.
"We won't see any big fluctuation in the coming days unless the Thai baht reacts again," he added.
